body:
The crab-eating fox is the only member of the genus Cerdocyon [\[1\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crab-eating_fox). It's a member of the Canini tribe, which makes it more closely related to dogs, wolves, and jackals than true foxes (which are in the Vulpini tribe) [\[2\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caninae#Phylogenetic_relationships). This makes "Crab-eating fox" a misnomer, ~~because it doesn't actually eat crabs~~ [\[3\]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Crab-eating_fox#Diet)

Despite this, it looks foxy enough to me.
body_html:
The crab-eating fox is the only member of the genus Cerdocyon [1]. It's a member of the Canini tribe, which makes it more closely related to dogs, wolves, and jackals than true foxes (which are in the Vulpini tribe) [2]. This makes "Crab-eating fox" a misnomer, because it doesn't actually eat crabs [3]

Despite this, it looks foxy enough to me.
